description: In an ideal world, managers could reliably make optimal business decisions, with sufficient time and information to support their case. Unfortunately, important strategic and business decision-making often happens without ample time or complete information, increasing the risk of suboptimal outcomes. This course focuses on teaching the essential consulting tools that are required to effectively address business decisions through a holistic synthesis of different functional frameworks. Many of these frameworks and perspectives will be equally valuable to corporate managers, who may take on ‘internal consultant’ tasks or roles in their future tenure.
title: A Consulting Toolkit For Strategic Decision-Making
